greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) = A124927(n,k) + A134058(n,k) - A007318(n,k), read by rows.
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 0..50 of the triangle, flattened
formula: T(n,k) = A124927(n,k) + A134058(n,k) - A007318(n,k) as infinite lower triangular matrices.
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
program: (MAGMA) [1] cat [k eq 0 select 2 else 3*Binomial(n,k): k in [0..n], n in [1..12]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, May 03 2021
flatten([[A134060(n,k) for k in (0..n)] for n in (0..12)]) # _G. C. Greubel_, May 03 2021
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Oct 05 2007
